result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M. Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct as a County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Suspension of drivers license for failure to pay

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin M. Acevedo in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gumz states he believes the matter will be resolved but due to Atty Middleton not being available today due a death in the family.  Court advises matter will remain on the JT calendar unless Br 3 takes it off.  Bond continued.

Defendant Justin M. Acevedo in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 3.  Bond continues.  Addressed confirmed.
No violent contact w/M.A.  Absolute sobriety.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Middleton requests 72 hrs to file authorization and states parties have agreed to amend the previously ordered cash bond to a signature bond.  All other previously ordered conditions would continue.  Atty Ryan is in agreement and states the conditions would be modified to "No violent contact w/M.A. and absolute sobriety at all times."  Court so orders cash bond amended to $1,000.00 signature bond w/special bond conditions of:  No violent contact w/M.A. and absolute sobriety at all times.

Pre-trial conference at 09-04-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 09-16-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Justin M. Acevedo appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $1000.00 Cash bond. Atty. Middleton argues for signature bond and conditions.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Court sets $500.00 Cash bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/M.A.; Absolute Sobriety; May get belongings w/law enforcement  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
